intro: [WRONG START] Embilia dahomensis, commonly known as the African embelia, is a shrub native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
